column4: Darn..he left...Ok what is a good program to run once I know an ip of a computer I want to scan for open ports?
nmap is a great port scanner
do "sudo nmap -sS 192.16.0.*"
no quotes :P
That is what I am saying it doesn't work
pastebin?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/16580
I didn't mention this is over a wireless connection..does that matter?
you need to replace the * with the IP
wireless connection shouldn't matter
Same message if I do so
And I did ping the ip to make sure I get a reply after nmap -sP 192.168.0.*
what is your system arch?
Ubuntu PPC
did you do "sudo apt-get install nmap" or did you build from source?
Nope did apt-get install nmap
googling...one sec
Ok...
weird -- seems to be a mix of problems with non-i386 arch's and being compiled with gcc4
does it run okay if you don't use root?
Ok..any suggestions for a alternative that might work? Well I did get it to list the ips on my lan without root...other than that no
maybe try knocker?  sudo apt-get install knocker
Ok thanks...I have to run and eat thanks for the help!!!
